sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: The Writings of Martin Bucer, Pierre Alexandre and others
M. Buceri, Petri Alexandri et aliorum scripta
msDesc.p:
Paper, 315 215
12 x 8.5, pp. 595, Cent. xvi, many hands.
Flyleaf from the same service-book as in MS 102, pasted over. (ff. iiir-iiiv)

msItem.head: Martin Bucer, Commentary on the gospel of St Matthew

head.title: Annotationes Martini Buceri in octo priora capita evangelii secundum Matthaeum

msItem.ab:
Partly autograph: has some titles etc. written by Cranmer.
A comment by Bucer on the Gospels was printed by Stephanus in 1530, 1536 etc.: but it differs from this

msItem.head: John Cheke, English translation of St Matthew's gospel

head.title: Translation of the gospell of St. Matthew and part of the first chapter of St. Mark into English by sir John Cheek with marginal notes

msItem.head: Pierre Alexandre, Commentary on the gospel of St Mark

head.title: Annotationes Petri Alexandri in quinque priora capita evangelii secundum Marcum una cum versione Latina

msItem.head: Matthew Parker, Notes on the governance of the churches in France and Belgium

head.title: Breves notae de regulis ecclesiae Gallicanae, et Belgicae prescribendis a Matthaeo Parkero

msItem.head: Thomas Cranmer, Annotations to 'institutions of a Christian man'

head.title: Annotations upon the kings book [by archbishop Cranmer]

ab.quote: By the king's book is meant, the Erudition of a Christian man published by Henry VIII

msItem.ab: Parker Society, Cranmer II 83. Strype, Cranmer I 137

msItem.head: Edmund Gheast, A sermon on Mark 1. 15, 'Repent and believe the gospel'

head.title: A sermon on Mark 1. 15, 'Repent and believe the gospel' by Gheast bishop of Rochester, preached [probably at court] 1560

msItem.ab: Printed in H. G. Dugdale's Life of Bishop Gheast 1840, Appendix VII

msItem.head: Thomas Cranmer, Of the consolation of christian men against the fear of death taken from the fathers

head.title: Of the consolation of christian men against the fear of death taken from the fathers, by archbishop Cranmer

msItem.ab: Autograph. See Strype, Cranmer, Appendix XXXII

msItem.head: Thomas Cranmer, An exhortation to take sickness well and adversity patiently, drawn out of Ciprian

head.title: An exhortation to take sickness well and adversity patiently, drawn out of Ciprian, by the same

msItem.ab: Autograph. See Strype, Cranmer, Appendix XXXII

msItem.head: Thomas Cranmer, An exhortation to take the paynes of sickness patiently, translated out of Augustin liber I, 'de visitatione infirmorum'

head.title: An exhortation to take the paynes of sickness patiently, translated out of Augustin liber I, 'de visitatione infirmorum' by the same

msItem.ab: Autograph. See Strype, Cranmer, Appendix XXXII

msItem.head: Nicholas Robinson, A sermon on the character of Cain

head.title: A sermon of M. Robinson on the character of Cain

msItem.ab: Nicholas Robinson Bishop of Bangor: extract in Strype, Parker I 465

msItem.head: Hugh Latimer, Homily delivered before King Edward V on the qualities to be displayed by a king

head.title: Homelia quaedam Hugonis Latymeri habita coram rege Edwardo, in qua qualis rex esse debeat ostenditur, Latine versa per Magistrum Banks

msItem.ab: This is the first of Latimer's sermons before the king. Parker Society, Sermons of Latimer, p. 85

msItem.head: Urbanus Rhegius, Whether a heretical magistrate is to be obeyed translated by Jacobus Gislenus Thalassius

head.title: Num in hereticos jure magistratuum gravius animadvertere liceat, decisio Urbani Rhegii, interprete Jacobo Gisleno Thalassio, 1539

ab.handNote: Articles 12-15 are in one hand: a curious upright script. It recurs in MS 109, article 12

ab.ref: Urbanus Regius' works were printed in 1562 at Nuremberg

msItem.incipit: Quom ex sententia pauli manifestum sit

msItem.head: Urbanus Rhegius (attrib.), De conciliis et ecclesiis

head.title: Ejusdem autoris de conciliis et ecclesiis tractatus

ab.handNote: Articles 12-15 are in one hand: a curious upright script. It recurs in MS 109, article 12

ab.ref: Urbanus Regius' works were printed in 1562 at Nuremberg

msItem.incipit: Non sine cachinno vidi saepius adolescens cani famelico panem ostentari sed eius loco verbera fuisse exhibita

head.title: Historia Hussica liber iii, incerto autore

ab.quote: Doctrinae reformatae se maxime infensum ostendit, et Hussum juste fuisse crematum asserit: Stylum et mentem hujus autoris satis cognoscet lector ex sequenti sententia quam ex sermone episcopi Laudensis cum laude citat. Hi duo Huss et Hieronimus patriae pestes fuerunt... quorum matres si unquam peccaverunt, certe nullum flagitium gravius committere potuerunt quam quod ubera talibus labiis sugenda prebuere. Non recte adscribitur haec historia Urbano Rhegio a Cl. Stanley

ab.handNote: Articles 12-15 are in one hand: a curious upright script. It recurs in MS 109, article 12

msItem.incipit: Paulo ante tempora Ioannis husz regnauit in bohemia carolus quartus
msItem.explicit: nec ipsi bohemi de hussii sanctitate multum gloriantur, quandoquidem rem ipsam iuxta mecum intelligunt

head.title: Sermon of consolation to the Germans

ab.handNote: Articles 12-15 are in one hand: a curious upright script. It recurs in MS 109, article 12

msItem.incipit: Vulgo iactatum est prouerbium. difficulter nolenti subuenitur. Audiuimus germani multis iam annis dulce illud et saluberrimum verbum dei
msItem.ab: Much against the Electors of Mainz and Brandenburg
On p. 595 is written in the same hand
forma orandi deum aduersus turcam. M : Lut : (Lutheri)
la : g : tha : inter : 1542 (i.e. Jacobo Gisleno Thalassio interprete)
